snippet: The main contractor in Maryland’s initially flawed health care exchange website has agreed to repay $45 million to avoid legal action, officials announced Tuesday.
abstract: Noridian Healthcare Solutions agrees to repay $45 million to avoid legal action over its role in failure of Maryland's flawed health care exchange website, which crashed as soon as it went online as part of Affordable Care Act.
lead_paragraph: The main contractor in Maryland’s initially flawed health care exchange website has agreed to repay $45 million to avoid legal action, officials announced Tuesday.

headline.main: Maryland: Contractor to Pay for Flawed Website Design
headline.print_headline: Maryland: Contractor to Pay for Flawed Website Design

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
